answers.answer: How your feeling is normal.  Surgery is considered trauma on your body it will take time to heal. Remember- your thyroid controls ALOT in your body and now your body must adjust to living without it.  Hang in there it DOES get better.best wishes

question: I had a large mass on my thyroid that was biopsied. My thyroid level testing comes back normal but I am still not feeling well.I did not feel like this before my surgery. I just can't seem to feel better. Could it be side effects from  the anesthesia.My throat keeps getting sore on and off.My voice is still working on recovering. How long can it take to feel better. I am dreading the thought of a second surgery as I am having a hard recovering from my first.My doc said I should have recovered by now.I think I had a bad reaction from the anesthesia. I am also type II diabetes with excellent control.The surgery threw my diabetes for a loop and I had to go back to the hospital after they dismissed me.It was quite a challenging event.I could not believe they sent home right after surgery in the first place.The ENT doctor told me he will not do that after the second surgery.
